intro: Castilleja villosissima, commonly known as the woolly milkvetch, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, often reddish stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and sagebrush steppe. It forms symbiotic relationships with certain root fungi, which help it obtain nutrients from host plants. Its unique ecological role makes it an important species in its native ecosystems.
